Class Server.SockServer

java.lang.Object
Server.SockServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
Enclosing class:
Server
private class Server.SockServer extends Object implements Runnable
Inner class representing an individual client handler. Each SockServer instance manages the communication with a single client, handling requests related to the shared Binary Search Tree.

  • Constructor Details

    • SockServer

      public SockServer(int counterIn, BinarySearchTree bst)
      Constructor for the SockServer class.
      Parameters:
      counterIn - The unique ID assigned to the client.
      bst - The shared Binary Search Tree.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs the client handler, processing the initial connection and handling client requests. This method manages a client connection, from establishing streams to handling client requests and closing the connection.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • getStreams

      private void getStreams()
      Initializes the input and output streams for communication with the client. This method creates ObjectInputStream and ObjectOutputStream instances using the client's socket InputStream and OutputStream, respectively. It also flushes the output stream to ensure that any buffered data is sent immediately.

    • waitForClientConnection

      private void waitForClientConnection() throws IOException
      Waits for and accepts an incoming client connection on the server socket. This method blocks until a client connects to the server, at which point it accepts the connection and sets the clientConnection field to the connected socket.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while waiting for a client connection.

    • processInitialConnection

      private void processInitialConnection() throws IOException
      Processes the initial connection with the client by sending a success message and initiating the processing of user input.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while processing the initial connection.

    • processUserInput

      private void processUserInput()
      Processes user input received from the connected client. Processes what to do for every action a client can perform when interacting with the binary search tree.

    • sendConfirmationToClient

      private void sendConfirmationToClient()
      Sends a confirmation message to the connected client, indicating that the server is ready for the next user action.

    • sendBSTTraversalToClients

      private void sendBSTTraversalToClients(List<Integer> traversalResult, String traversalType)
      Sends the result of a binary search tree traversal to all connected clients.
      Parameters:
      traversalResult - The result of the binary search tree traversal.
      traversalType - The type of traversal (e.g., In-order, Pre-order, Post-order).

    • sendData

      private void sendData(String messageToClient)
      Sends a message to the connected client.
      Parameters:
      messageToClient - The message to be sent to the client.

    • closeConnection

      private void closeConnection() throws IOException
      Closes the connection with the current client including input and output streams.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while closing the connection.
